Comments_List:
History of Arabic poetry, its methods and problems
Translation, having its joys and overcoming its challenges 
Collective consideration of poetic and grammatical expressions,
new and creative ways of thinking about poetry

One strength of the course is it combines teaching of Arabic poetry with that of language through a close and enjoyable study of a solid piece of classical Arabic poetry with an instructive commentary of its meaning with a particular focus on grammar

One weakness might be that there are different levels of students engaging in the same text, but overall it did not have a negative effect on the beautiful learning environment thanks to the Professors' flexible teaching methods

Yes, I would recommend it to another student who is interested in Arabic and Islamic studies because it is not only highly instructive in the classical Arabic  grammar and culture but also a lot of fun, thanks to Prof. Shawkat Toorawa's dynamic and energetic performance during the whole session.
